image.altText: Irish players Kayleigh Cronin, Grace Kelly, Amy Boyle-Carr and Niamh Kelly sitting on a lounge.

props.synopsis: The Adelaide Crows' squad for the AFLW campaign will have a pronounced Irish brogue, with four players hailing from the Emerald Isle — and while they've joked about the accent barrier, they believe it's their Gaelic footy skills that will best translate in their new surrounds.

title.children: For a Crows quartet with an Irish lilt, footy 'translates very well'

image.altText: An algal bloom warning sign at Somerton along Adelaide's coast.

props.synopsis: As the latest water testing results reveal rising algal levels along parts of the Adelaide coast, the opposition says Freedom of Information documents show government "buck-passing" marked the early months of the bloom.

title.children: Algal levels rising at Adelaide jetties amid 'buck-passing' claims

image.altText: Flames and smoke from a building on Hindley Street.

props.synopsis: A fire that ripped through a food business on Hindley Street is believed to have started in a deep fryer, with the Metropolitan Fire Service saying early indications suggest a damage bill of up to $400,000.

title.children: Adelaide CBD fire sends flames 'blasting' onto Hindley Street

image.altText: A crowd of people gather under a lot of flags at a climate conference.

props.synopsis: Australia's bid to host next year's UN climate conference in Adelaide is taking longer than expected, raising concerns about preparations for an event described as the country's "biggest since the 2000 Olympics in Sydney".

title.children: 'Runway getting shorter' for Australia's COP31 ambitions as Türkiye holds firm

image.altText: A young man in a black shirt signing a piece of paper with a small blue flag with a club logo on it in front of him.

props.synopsis: Mount Gambier's Bae Versace has achieved his dream by signing with a European football club, the youth division of FK Budućnost Podgorica in the Balkan capital of Montenegro.

title.children: Soccer player from Mt Gambier snapped up by European club

image.altText: Collage of acts playing Adelaide's Harvest Rock 2025 lineup.

props.synopsis: Back after a rough year off, the two-day festival sees The Strokes, Jelly Roll and The War On Drugs mix it up with a host of impressive homegrown acts.

title.children: Adelaide's Harvest Rock festival revived with bumper 2025 line-up

image.altText: Three people standing in front of an old train carriage

props.synopsis: As the farming community battles drought, the 10 per cent rate bump is the highest of any SA council this year and comes after the state government flagged "serious financial concerns".

title.children: SA's highest council rate hike leaves locals seeking answers

image.altText: A man wearing shorts, tshirt and sneakers and a backpack stands on a sandy track with ocean in the background

props.synopsis: The SA government says it has received a complaint about emails sent by former Liberal leader David Speirs promoting a fundraiser for a charity hike, but Mr Speirs has denied that he has misused private information.

title.children: David Speirs denies misusing email list to promote charity fundraiser

image.altText: Students in the classroom at Mistake Creek State School.

props.synopsis: There's a bunch of factors behind a persistent divide in educational levels of urban and regional students. Teacher shortages are one part of the problem.

title.children: The city-country education divide driven by 'wicked policy problem'

image.altText: A woman sits at a laptop with her dog next to her.

props.synopsis: Depression, cancer, sleep apnoea and migraines are among the leading health burdens on our workforce and it's costing Australia billions of dollars in lost work and lowered productivity, new research reveals.

title.children: Depression, breast cancer and migraines are costing the economy billions

image.altText: An aerial shot of suburban homes stretching into the distance.

props.synopsis: As industry leaders and the federal government prepare for next week's economic summit, two economists have started a national conversation by arguing that, to make Australia's tax system fairer, we should consider taxing home owner-occupancy. Here's what that means.

title.children: 'Imputed rent' and what it could mean for a fairer Australia

image.altText: Piles of timber and brick waste on a blank piece of land in the Mallee. The dirt is dry and brown with a few green shrubs.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide demolition company and its director are found guilty of illegally dumping thousands of tonnes of asbestos-contaminated waste.

title.children: Demolition firm ordered to pay $700k for illegally dumping asbestos

image.altText: A very large dead great white shark found on a beach in Louth Bay.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a 5-metre great white shark missing its jaws is labelled "bizarre and worrying" by an illegal animal trade expert.

title.children: Great white shark found with missing jaws sparks illegal trade concerns

image.altText: The exterior of a Coles supermarket at night, with the name "coles" on light-up letters.

props.synopsis: Cleaning up even a small amount of a $110 billion "red tape burden" could deliver billions in savings, the Business Council of Australia says, ahead of next week's economic reform round table.

title.children: Business Council calls out $110bn 'red tape burden', saying clean-up could save billions

image.altText: A young white girl with long brown hair pulled back into pig tails. She is vision-impaired, wearing glasses and a school uniform

props.synopsis: Japanese is one of the most studied languages for high schoolers — but few do it like Jacinta McIntyre. The 14-year-old is blind and learning the language through braille.

title.children: How this teenage girl is learning Japanese using braille

image.altText: Deb knelt next to a stone headstone.

props.synopsis: Months after New South Wales became the first state to reform the "outdated" law banning people from being laid to rest with their pets, advocates are urging the Victorian government to catch up.

title.children: Calls to change 'outdated' laws to permit owners to be buried with their pets

image.altText: An old photo of a young soldier in a frame.

props.synopsis: For 100-year-old veteran Leslie "Doc" Sinclair, the memory of the day he heard World War II was over is one of relief, not elation.

title.children: 80 years on, veterans remember the day victory was declared in WWII

image.altText: An older man in a checked shirt and vest sits on a bench outside an old Australian cinema.

props.synopsis: The critic, author and educator was known for his decades-long on-screen partnership with co-host Margaret Pomeranz, as well as his promotion of Australian cinema — plus his lifelong battle against film censorship.

title.children: 'Giant in his field': Legendary film critic David Stratton dies aged 85

image.altText: Jim Chalmers and Anthony Albanese laugh at a pub in Brisbane

props.synopsis: This week in politics the government abandoned a confusing word and a former foreign minister rejected bullying allegations.

title.children: Labor is no longer using the P-word and Julie Bishop disputes ANU allegations

image.altText: A child wearing traditional black clothing and head covering, wearing sunglasses, holding a paddle.

props.synopsis: Rayyan Arkan Dikha became a social media sensation for his spontaneous dance atop a racing boat. Now, there are warnings of impersonators trying to profit off his fame.

title.children: After the aura farming boy went viral, the online scams started

image.altText: Taylor Swift smiles as she plays guitar on stage in an orange dress

props.synopsis: It was another huge week of news. Did you catch it all? Test your memory here.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A cryptic countdown, chess sensation and a collision

image.altText: Trump spruiks 'very friendly' call with Zelenskyy ahead of meeting with Putin

props.synopsis: Members of a visiting delegation of US Congress members from both sides of politics have stressed the importance of a face-to-face meeting between President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese.

title.children: Pro-AUKUS congress members say Albanese must secure Trump sit-down

image.altText: A man in front of a microphone wearing headphones making expressions with his hands and face

props.synopsis: The Productivity Commission says artificial intelligence could offer a $116 billion shot in the arm to Australia's economy. But for people like voice actor Colin Cassidy, that means a disruption to their daily work.

title.children: Voice actors are already losing work to an AI disruption expected to reach everything

image.altText: An Air New Zealand aeroplane flying over the framework of a building construction.

props.synopsis: Residents are encouraged to weigh in as the consultation period on proposed changes draws to a close.

title.children: 'Noise spread' approach suggested for Brisbane flight paths

image.altText: A Sydney train at a red light

props.synopsis: Sydney Trains CEO Matt Longland says only a handful of incidents this year would have posed a potential danger to passengers.

title.children: Number of Sydney trains running red lights jumps 25pc, data shows

image.altText: A man and a woman in green and gold tracksuit tops fold their arms and look down at the camera.

props.synopsis: Sickness ruled their childhoods, but Emma, Jacob and their parents weren't giving up. Now, thanks to transplants, the duo are representing Australia at the World Transplant Games.

title.children: These siblings weren't sure they'd live past 30 years old, now they're representing Australia

image.altText: Keely Sherar of Carlton is tackled by Violet Patterson of Collingwood

props.synopsis: Carlton has started the 10th season of the AFLW with a win over arch-rivals Collingwood at Princes Park.

title.children: Blues and Eagles begin new AFLW season with opening night wins

image.altText: A close up a UTS logo on a large building's windows

props.synopsis: The University of Technology Sydney is suspending more than 100 courses as it prepares for a controversial redundancy program to save $100 million.

title.children: Uni staff told to 'wash delicates' for stress management as 146 courses suspended

image.altText: ABC radio caller Andrew Moore.

props.synopsis: Andrew Moore, ABC Sport's chief rugby league caller for the past decade, is recovering in hospital after having surgery following a heart attack.

title.children: ABC radio caller Andrew Moore recovering after surgery following heart attack

image.altText: Jim Chalmers walks down a corridor.

props.synopsis: The treasurer has downplayed a leaked document from his department that included possible outcomes of the government's upcoming productivity round table, saying it shouldn't come as a "big surprise" that briefings have been prepared.

title.children: Chalmers defends 'genuine' productivity talks after possible outcomes leaked

image.altText: Tassal salmon pens in Macquarie Harbour, southwest Tasmania.

props.synopsis: It's six times the size of Sydney Harbour and the only place an endangered species of ray lives in the wild. It is also home to industrial-scale salmon production. So, will this week's decision by the government in favour of fish farming end the arguing over Macquarie Harbour?

title.children: Is the debate over salmon farming in Macquarie Harbour settled?

image.altText: A man with a white shirt and tie walking alongside a woman with a black top.

props.synopsis: Fatal crash pilot Sebastian Robinson has denied lying to police about the cause of the accident under cross-examination in Matt Wright's criminal trial.

title.children: Pilot left paraplegic after fatal crash denies lying to investigators

image.altText: People cross the road at an intersection in a busy CBD.

props.synopsis: Employment increased by nearly 25,000 people, driven by 60,000 full-time jobs, and the number of unemployed people also fell in the month.

title.children: Unemployment rate improvement tipped to keep RBA 'on sidelines'

image.altText: black and white portrait photo of Paul Kelly, wearing business shirt and folding hands in front of his face

props.synopsis: Almost 30 years since releasing his beloved Christmas anthem, the beloved Australian songwriter has penned a dark comic sequel — the first single from his 30th studio album.

title.children: Rita Wrote A Letter is the sequel to Paul Kelly's most iconic song
